conclusion: Identify the forces acting on the sled: weight of child and sled, pulling force by adult, normal force by ground.
Calculate the weight of the child and the sled: W = 400 N.
Resolve the pulling force into components: horizontal component Fx = 80 N, vertical component Fy = 60 N.
Determine the normal force: N = W - Fy = 340 N.
Magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is equal to the normal force, which is 340 N.
Final Answer: The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
